properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy rain will continue today over the Central Coast and North Vancouver Island. A frontal wave will continue to bring heavy rain to the coastal sections of the Central Coast and to North Vancouver Island today. The rain will ease this evening. Total rainfall amounts for the event are expected to range from 120 to 150 mm by this evening on the Central Coast with about 90 mm near Port Alice. The heavy rain on top of antecedent moisture increases the risk of localised flooding or road washouts. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-28T04:29:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-27T12:30:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2108519273.2020
Area: North Vancouver Island, Central Coast - coastal sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected tonight. Fog is developing this evening and is expected to persist overnight. Fog will dissipate Saturday morning. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-28T15:59:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-28T02:44:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0599202336.2020
Area: Maxville - Alexandria, Winchester - Newington, Prescott and Russell
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow developed last night over the inland sections of the central coast. Snowfall accumulation of 18 cm was received at Bella Coola airport overnight, and an additional 20 cm today. Snow is expected to turn to a rain-snow mix this afternoon briefly, then back to snow this evening. Snow will not be as heavy but will continue to accumulate tonight with a further 10 to 15 cm possible by Saturday morning, ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-28T13:25:35-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-27T21:26:35-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3824788405.2020
Area: Central Coast - inland sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, continues. A weather system with a front draped across Vancouver Island is producing a long episode of heavy rain, with rainfall amounts in excess of 100 mm locally. Heavy rain will continue early this evening, particularly near Zeballos and Tahsis. Rainfall amounts near 100 mm can be expected from this system. Rain will ease later this evening as the system exits the region. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-28T07:14:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-28T00:07:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1045134818.2020
Area: West Vancouver Island
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Southeast winds of up to 70 km/h will ease early this evening as the front exits the area. ### High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-28T06:14:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-28T00:02:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3705399179.2020
Area: East Vancouver Island - Nanoose Bay to Fanny Bay, East Vancouver Island - Courtenay to Campbell River, Sunshine Coast - Saltery Bay to Powell River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long period of snowfall with total amounts of 20 to 25 cm is expected. Heavy snow will continue over west-central Alberta tonight, with an additional 10 cm overnight. Most of the snow will occur north of Highway 16 and south of Highway 43. Areas from Beaverlodge to the City of Grande Prairie to Valleyview and north will get about 5 cm of snow this evening and overnight. The snow is expected to taper off on Saturday. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-28T14:45:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-27T22:46:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0764840881.2020

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long period of snowfall with total amounts of 20 to 25 cm is expected. Heavy snow is forecast to continue over west-central Alberta today, with the heaviest snow expected to occur north of Highway 16. Snowfall amounts will range between 10-15 cm today, with an additional 10 cm overnight. The snow is expected to taper off on Saturday. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. The strong winds in the Cypress Hills region have weakened in most areas, but wind gusts to 90 km/h are still occurring near the United States border. The wind should weaken this evening. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-28T07:29:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-28T00:12:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0720926351.2020

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds with severe and damaging gusts are expected or occurring. Strong winds are expected to strengthen tonight with wind gusts as high as 130 km/h are possible tonight and into Saturday morning. The wind will weaken Saturday afternoon. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-28T16:09:50-00:00

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. A frontal system moving across the northern Gulf of Alaska will spread snow at times heavy to Haines road beginning early on Saturday morning. The heaviest snowfall amounts will occur between Pleasant Camp and the Chilkat Pass where 25 cm of snow is expected. Southerly winds of 30 gusting to 50 km/h will accompany the snow reducing visibilities in blowing snow. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-28T19:06:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-28T03:07:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2797399738.2020
Area: Haines Road - Haines Junction to Pleasant Camp
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A weather system moving across the central interior continues to bring snow to most of the region. Snow will persist over the McGregor region and Yellowhead Highway this evening. Additional snowfall amounts of 5 to 10 cm are expected before the snow tapers off overnight. Over the Prince George, Stuart - Nechako regions and the southern sections of Lakes District, snow will ease to a few flurries later this evening. Further snowfall amounts of up to 5 cm are expected. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-28T17:16:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-28T01:17:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3339665335.2020
Area: Yellowhead Highway – Tête Jaune Cache to the Alberta Border
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Heavy snow and blowing snow is forecast for tonight over Highway 93, with total snowfall accumulations of 20 to 35 cm expected by Saturday morning. Strong winds are also expected over the region, with local gusts of 70-80 km/h possible in wind prone areas along the highway. This, in combination with the falling snow, will generate low visibility in blowing snow. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-28T11:59:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-27T22:43:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2165732964.2020
Area: Highway 93 - Lake Louise to Saskatchewan River Crossing, Highway 93 - Jasper to Saskatchewan River Crossing

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:

Wind gusts may reach 130 km/h in a few localities this evening and overnight. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
